meanings.definition: Denes (noun): A group of people living in a particular area.
meanings.sent1: The denes in the village gathered for a celebration.
meanings.sent2: The denes of the neighborhood often help each other out.
meanings.sent3: The denes decided to have a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent4: The denes formed a strong bond over time.
meanings.sent5: The denes' traditions have been passed down for generations.

meanings.definition: Denes (verb): To refuse or deny something.
meanings.sent1: She denes any involvement in the prank.
meanings.sent2: He denes the accusations made against him.
meanings.sent3: The cat denes eating the fish, but the evidence says otherwise.
meanings.sent4: The storm denes any attempts to go outside.
meanings.sent5: The teacher denes the students' request for extra recess time.

meanings.definition: Denes (adjective): Dark or gloomy in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The denes forest looked eerie in the moonlight.
meanings.sent2: The old house had a denes atmosphere that sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent3: The denes sky hinted at an approaching storm.
meanings.sent4: Her denes mood lifted when she received good news.
meanings.sent5: The denes clouds loomed ominously over the town.
